basics.name: Caleb Atwood
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: Full stack software developer looking for a platform or services developer role. My professional projects to date have primarily consisted of scaled backend services, database design, and web frontends for Xbox Live. Before that, I co-founded MyFit Inc, a computer vision startup which recieved angel funding and placement in one of the Bay Area tech accelerators. Outside of work, my personal projects span a broad range of topics... mobile react apps, crowd-sourced ecommerce sites, computer vision algorithms, 3D reconstruction applications, game development, drone construction, home-security hardware design, and several music projects.

work.summary: Service platform engineer on Xbox Live, the collection of services that comprise Xbox's social graph, catalog, content distribution, and multiplayer.
highlights: Primary dev on Xbox Developer Portal. Catalog, media ingestion, and frontend features.
Designed, implemented, and filed a patent on an innovative solution for remotely enabling devkit capabilities on retail Xbox devices. See Patents.
Lead an initiative to integrate the Xbox publishing backend with the Windows Dev Center frontend to enable large game binary encryption workflows in the Windows Dev Center
Designed and delivered a content and catalog management system for enabling user generated content, currently used in Minecraft's custom content store.

Managed a small team in architecting and implementing Game Modes, a real-time configuration service for describing custom gameplay options for multiplayer titles, currently driving tournament creation on Xbox.

work.summary: Integrated the Microsoft Kinect, cutting edge 3D computer vision algorithms, and a completely novel 3D in-browser experience in order to change the way consumers shop for clothes online.
highlights: In charge of system architecture design, task lead, back-end and front-end development, 2D and 3D computer vision implementation, and product design.
Oversaw team of 3 engineers spanning research, graphics, and platform development.
Won Plug and Play Fall EXPO, a Sunnyvale tech accelerator.

awards.title: Converting a Retail Gaming Device Into A Development Kit Remotely
awards.summary: This solution facilitates the activation of development capabilities remotely in order to allow any retail device to be used for development. I designed a device management service, which utilizes existing role management systems to grant runtime certificates to consoles on boot.

awards.title: Method and System for Creating a Virtual Avatar for Fitting Clothing
awards.summary: Inventor on a new method for uploading and processing 3 dimensional point cloud scans of the human body to simulate clothing physics on the reconstructed mesh.

publications.name: Festival
publications.summary: A React-Native + Redux IOS application built with Firebase for sharing geo-localized conversation and content at music festivals.

publications.name: Minecraft Go
publications.summary: An augmented reality mobile app based on Pokemon Go, with real terrain and procedurally generated structures that resemble those from the game Minecraft. Built with Unity, Google Places, and MapZen.

publications.name: More Games
publications.summary: Sky Vanguard (3D muliplayer cannon shooter), NDMatchMe (javascript college dating game), Marble Deep (3D multiplayer virtual chat space), Tanks (mobile arcade jumper), Rogue Rider (isometric wasteland driver).

publications.name: Other Projects
publications.summary: Ann Arbor Book Barter (open university book exchange), NDTees (college t-shirt marketplace), Facial Iterative Closest Point (biometric recognition), Magic The Recognition (automated card scanner), Norca (drummer of live performance group featuring 15 original songs).
